If you (we) are a simulation, you simply have the illusion of consciousness.

Yeah, Prusa is like the Elon Musk of the 3d Printing Community.

To be fair, it states a doubling in size between 40 and 80...but the rate of growth is not defined after that. It could be any growth, even if by a gram or two per year, and the statement would still be accurate.

No one here is going to want to hear this...but the "Service Dog" moniker is almost useless these days.
You can register your dog as a service dog, simply by filling out a form and mailing it in, along with your check for approx 80 bucks. Boom, you now have an "officially registered" service dog in the legal eyes of pretty much everyone. It can even accompany you a flight for free!
No training needed for the dog. No anything. It's akin to the old "Buy a star for your loved ones" star registry scam.
Granted...of course there are actual trained dogs meant to assist disabled persons. They are, however, legally, in the same category of Service Dog as your toy poodle you just registered so you could carry it in your purse on the way to Paris.
You win this round, Positive Polly, you win this round.

I did not put him down. I simply said that I, me, cannot tell a difference. I did not say there was no difference. Simply that the pictures were incongruous, to the point where they are not comparable. One is in resting state, the other is in flex state.
Not trying to sound bad or anything, but I can't tell a difference. Since you're flexing in the after picture, I can't compare the two very well. Everyone looks better flexing.

For those of you immediately siding with her, thinking it's wrong that had custody taken away....keep in mind how absolutely one-sided and complimentary this article paints her in. Make sure you're looking at this critically, and not in a "Awwww, poor lady...all mothers are wonderful" type of way.
There is nothing from "his" (husband) side of the story in this, and honestly, this article really sugar coats some serious issues that this woman had with substance abuse and mental problems. It blames the substance abuse and mental problems on her losing custody....but, let's be real here. Those things were probably already present, and just exacerbated by the stress of losing custody, and the trial. In fact, the article calls it a suicide...and says she died in bed from an overdose. This is also possibly sugar coating. It's quite possible that she "overdosed" the old fashioned way...by being a substance abuser, and they made her character look better by saying she must have done it on purpose.
Also keep in mind, a verdict of not guilty can be gotten by any shadow of doubt. The entire jury could have thought she did it, but with a lack of concrete evidence, and only hearsay to go upon, they would be forced to find her not guilty.
Yes, it's tragic those kids no longer have a mother. However, just because someone commits suicide (or accidentally overdoses), does not automatically make them the victim.
Source: Dealing with substance abusing wife that I gained custody of our kids from to protect them from her. Hearing it from her "side" though, people think I'm a monster for "taking the kids away from their mother".

You got scammed. This is a common scam, where a vendor will put a product significantly and even ridiculously lower than all the competition. Buyers, such as yourself, end up placing an order, and now the scammer has your address and name and phone number. They then take that information and can sell it to the kind of people that buy that information. You will never receive that product.

It does not make someone evil at all.
Is someone evil if they ball up a sheet of paper and throw it in the trash, thus ending it's usefulness? Of course not. To us...a sheet of paper has the same sentience as lines of code.
I.e. none.
Of course you are, of course you are. Definitely not a program at all. No sir, definitely not.

I appreciate your responses, that's good stuff. We'll have to agree to disagree though. And now, I must head to my simulation of sleep, and hope I can catch a glimpse, however fleeting, of our evil benefactors.

You completely miss my meaning. Your statement is human-centric, based on what we know about conscious. If we're programs, we were made to think we're conscious, and it's all artificial. We would not and could not comprehend the true nature of the programmers reality.

The problem with your argument, is that it is completely human-centric. You are applying *our* morality code to our possible programmers. It could be that suffering and pain is simply a construct introduced into this version of the simulation, as a variable, to test something different from the last time the simulation was run.
We, being part of the simulation, would not even be able to comprehend the non-existence of suffering, due to it being the only reality we know.
Perhaps the physiology of the programmers, or even their society, revels in suffering. Maybe suffering to them is the ultimate thing in life, as it makes them aware of being alive. (i.e. loosely, the Klingons from Star Trek)
Ultimately, there is no way to ascribe suffering in our reality to the morality of our potential programmers. To do so only takes into account our limited frame of reference (Our own reality)

This is a bunk idea.
#5 is complete malarkey.
I don't think twice when I set my Sims house on fire, and end up killing him. I don't consider myself evil. You know why?....because to me, he's not real. He's code. He's computer code, no matter how "lifelike" he appears in my Sims "simulation".
If we are in a simulation...to the programmer, creator, player...whatever, we wouldn't be "real". We are code...., hence causing us to suffer would be meaningless to the creators sense of morals.

[Spoiler on The Long Walk ahead]
King's story The Long Walk, I read it back in the early 90's in high school. I loved it...it was the first time I'd experience a "twist" in a story. (Not a traditional twist, but more like a..."Oh, a race..ok...hmm, they're all kids...wait..what's that mean...OMG THEY ARE KILLING THEM" type of twist.
I, and my 13 year old mind, thought the story was amazing.
I haven't read it again in my life...because I'm afraid that it won't hold up now that I'm an adult, and I'd prefer to have good memories of it.
Or Tobey McGuire

I'll save you the trouble by describing it.
Picture...a lithe and agile tarantula, with long legs..hairy...and what looks like the ability to jump from two feet away and land on your face. That's about right.
All Your Food Belong to Us

You're disregarding the reality of a nuclear explosion on American soil or in a port.
Let's wargame this a second...a nuke explodes a short distance away from Norfolk Naval Station in Virginia, which wipes out a large part of our ships in port.
What now? Who did it? How did it get there? Was it on a boat?...on a sub?....was it a missile that came in from farther offshore? We'd have no idea. The evidence would be destroyed in the explosion.
Who do we blame? What if every known adversary in the World denies doing it...who do we retaliate against?
We would be like a hornets nest getting poked by a stick...and we would have no outlet for our rage, except blame and accusations. I think, soon after that, we'd start a nuke exchange with..someone...and then it's the end of the book of humanity.
On the other hand, playing Battlefield in real life will be easy. And mandatory.

A case of Coke is 1640 Calories. You'd be hard pressed to find something that gives you 1640 Calories for only $4.50.
So, yes, soda is a very efficient way to get more Calories per $.

WRITING.TITLE: LPT: If you enjoy flying kites, buy a cheap, half-length fishing pole and tie the fishing line to your kite.
WRITING.TEXT:
Advantages: It makes "spooling in" the kite almost effortless, as you just reel it in. You can fit much more line in a fishing reel than you can in a kite string spool. (Higher flying kites!) Fishing line is much lighter than kite string. (Higher flying kites!)
You can get higher test strength fishing line if you have a bigger kite or the wind is super strong.

WRITING.TITLE: If you enjoy flying kites, buy a cheap, half lengthed fishing pole and tie the fishing line to your kite.
